How many people are affected by hypokalemic periodic paralysis ?,"Although its exact prevalence is unknown, hypokalemic periodic paralysis is estimated to affect 1 in 100,000 people. Men tend to experience symptoms of this condition more often than women.",GHR,hypokalemic periodic paralysis
What are the genetic changes related to hypokalemic periodic paralysis ?,"Mutations in the CACNA1S and SCN4A genes cause hypokalemic periodic paralysis.  The CACNA1S and SCN4A genes provide instr
